title: Dino Toppmöller
text:
Dino Nicolas Toppmöller (born 23 November 1980) is a German <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager and former player.
Managerial career.
In June 2016, Toppmöller became manager of <a href="F91%20Dudelange">F91 Dudelange</a>, having taken them to the Group Stages of the <a href="UEFA%20Europa%20League">UEFA Europa League</a> for the first time in the club's history in 2018–19, campaign which F91 Dudelange have finished with one point following a draw in their last game against Real Betis. This feat made history in Luxembourg's football history, as Dudelange were not just the first team to have ever qualified in the group stages of any European competition, but they also managed to obtain a point. He joined Belgian outfit <a href="R.E.%20Virton">Virton</a> following that season, having spent a brief stint with them before being released after just one season.
On 20 July 2020, he was introduced as assistant coach to <a href="Julian%20Nagelsmann">Julian Nagelsmann</a> at <a href="RB%20Leipzig">RB Leipzig</a>. On 18 June 2021, he followed coach Nagelsmann to be his assistant at <a href="FC%20Bayern%20Munich">Bayern Munich</a>.
Personal life.
He is the son of <a href="Klaus%20Toppm%C3%B6ller">Klaus Toppmöller</a>. He was named after <a href="Dino%20Zoff">Dino Zoff</a>.
